Posted By: pedrodyl (7/30/2011 3:10:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
its freakin storm crow
  
   
edit
  
   
another brilliant creature for the insanely broken bird tribal. when this was in standard, it warped the whole metagame, people were maindecking creatures that specifically had higher power than [storm crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=storm crow), even if it cost them much more. and a lot of decks even had creature removal to deal with this.
  
   
people think that new phyrexia will change legacy, but [gut shot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=gut shot) doesn't even kill [storm crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=storm crow), so i doubt that.
  
   
and to the person talking about someone using [fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=fling) on [storm crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=storm crow) obviously didn't realise that fling deals the damage, not [storm crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=storm crow) so that combo doesn't work.
  
   
hah, power creep indeed
  
   
edit
  
   
triumphs over legacy staples [moat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=moat) and [mental misstep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mental misstep)
posts.html:
its freakin storm crow

edit

another brilliant creature for the insanely broken bird tribal. when this was in standard, it warped the whole metagame, people were maindecking creatures that specifically had higher power than storm crow, even if it cost them much more. and a lot of decks even had creature removal to deal with this.

people think that new phyrexia will change legacy, but gut shot doesn't even kill storm crow, so i doubt that.

and to the person talking about someone using fling on storm crow obviously didn't realise that fling deals the damage, not storm crow so that combo doesn't work.

hah, power creep indeed

posts.post_content:
I was playing a friend with my casual sliver deck. I had just played a kicked [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication )  on my [Might Sliver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Might Sliver), so I had 18 unblockable, double striking, lifelinking, shrouded, etc. 15/15 creatures. On the next turn, he played this card. I couldn't believe my eyes. I looked at the card, read it over a couple of times, and scooped. How could a couple of comparatively vanilla 15/15's stand up to this? Plus, it rhymed. "Descending" and "unending?" How cool is that?  
  
I was an instant convert. The next day, I made a mono blue deck with 56 islands and a playset of these as the only win condition. I took it to a local tournament and showed it off to a couple of people there ("LOOK AT THIS AND WEEP!!!!"). Based on the nervous laughter and expressions of disbelief ("Is this some sort of sick joke?") that I got, I could tell that they were terrified of the sheer power of the storm crow.  
  
Also, I know that there are a lot of haters out t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
One day, I was browsing the grand encyclopedia that is gatherer and stumbled across a comment that said the words, "Strictly better than Storm Crow."  
  
As always, I clicked the link. Needless to say, when my unworthy eyes began to examine the card.  
  
Before noticing anything, I deducted that the card was blue.  
  
My gaze moved up to the name box. "Storm Crow." Yes this was obviously the right card.  
  
I turned my head clockwise, 20 degrees. Mana cost is ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol).  
  
Looked down at the type box. "Creature - Bird." Minor tribal synergy with cards from the *Odyssey* and *Onslaught* Blocks.  
  
I looked at the power and toughness box. "1/2." That is good. It puts them on a twenty turn clock.   
  
Then, the moment that changed my life, I gazed unto the textbox, and read... "Flying." ARE YOU SERIOUS? THAT SETS IT OVER THE EDGE! I mean think about it!  
  
If you won the roll, this will come out the turn before your opponents [Tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarmogoyf). Turn three, attack with the crow. Your opponent... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: yangw (8/28/2011 10:34:26 PM)

posts.post_content:
There comes a time in deckbuilding when the blue mage has to choose a path. Counters and bounce spells are easy to pick. A soft lock isn't hard either. The true question is the win condition.  
Do you pick a big stompy Emrakul that simply ends the game quickly in two or three attacks?  
Or do you peck them to death, one turn at a time, whilst relishing the scent of your opponent's agony and despair?  
Truly, Storm Crow is one of the darkest creatures in *Magic: The Gathering.* Joke about Storm Crow all you want, but I'd rather be up against so many other things.
posts.html:

Do you pick a big stompy Emrakul that simply ends the game quickly in two or three attacks?
Or do you peck them to death, one turn at a time, whilst relishing the scent of your opponent's agony and despair?
Truly, Storm Crow is one of the darkest creatures in Magic: The Gathering. Joke about Storm Crow all you want, but I'd rather be up against so many other things.

5. [Bull Rush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bull Rush) - total powercreep. and people used to think [Brute Force](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brute Force) was good!  
  
4. [Razor Boomerang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Razor Boomerang) - a measily 5 mana for an entire one damage! THANK YOU!  
  
3. [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp) - this card dominated standard during it's time. Affinity decks feared facing the unstoppable chimney imp decks!  
  
2. [Wood Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wood Elemental) - a turn five 1/1! plus, you get to sac a pesky forest while you're at it! BAH-ROKEN!
